sentence.Network_en: The signs of an economic revival are only just beginning.
sentence.Network_cn: 经济复苏的迹象刚刚开始显现。

sentence.Network_en: People were beginning to attribute superhuman qualities to him.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们开始觉得他超人一等。

sentence.Network_en: This kind of living was beginning to fray her nerves.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种生活开始让她神经紧张。

jx.jx_en_mean: the point or event to which ending or failure can be traced
jx.jx_cn_mean: 预示最后结果或败局的先兆

entry.def: The beginning of an event or process is the first part of it.

example.ex: This was also the beginning of her recording career...
example.tran: 这也是她唱片生涯的开始。

example.ex: Think of this as a new beginning.

entry.def: The beginnings of something are the signs or events which form the first part of it.

example.ex: I had the beginnings of a headache...
The discussions were the beginnings of a dialogue with Moscow.
example.tran: 讨论拉开了同莫斯科对话的序幕。

entry.def: The beginning of a period of time is the time at which it starts.

example.ex: The wedding will be at the beginning of March.

entry.def: The beginning of a piece of written material is the first words or sentences of it.

example.ex: ...the question which was raised at the beginning of this chapter.
example.tran: 在本章开头所提出的问题

entry.def: If you talk about the beginnings of a person, company, or group, you are referring to their backgrounds or origins.

example.ex: His views come from his own humble beginnings.
example.tran: 他的观点源于他卑微的出身。

entry.def: You use beginning to describe someone who is in the early stages of learning to do something.

example.ex: The people that she had in her classroom were beginning learners.
example.tran: 她带的这班学生都是初学者。

means.word_mean: 1. the event consisting of the start of something;
2. the time at which something is supposed to begin;

sentences.sentence: "she knew from the get-go that he was the man for her"

means.word_mean: 3. the first part or section of something;

sentences.sentence: "`It was a dark and stormy night' is a hackneyed beginning for a story"

means.word_mean: 4. the place where something begins, where it springs into being;

sentences.sentence: "Jupiter was the origin of the radiation"
"Pittsburgh is the source of the Ohio River"
"he was responsible for the beginning of negotiations"

auth_sentence.content: The guitar solo at the beginning of the interview.
auth_sentence.res_content: The guitar solo at the beginning of the interview.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The guitar solo at the beginning of the interview.

auth_sentence.content: We lost a lot of points at the beginning.
auth_sentence.res_content: We lost a lot of points at the beginning.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We lost a lot of points at the beginning.

auth_sentence.content: I was beginning to think that I was insane.
auth_sentence.res_content: I was beginning to think that I was insane.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I was beginning to think that I was insane.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词,"状态物品,行业等"; 2. 表介词,"在……情况下……"; 3. 表形容词,"正……的或令人……的"; 4. "……的"

stems_affixes.word_buile: advertise做广告+ing行业→n.广告业;广告活动 adj.广告的;广告业务的
assume假装,假定+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.傲慢的,不逊的,僭越的
change变化+ing正……的或令人……的→正在变化的
correspond通信;符合+ing……的→adj.相应的,通讯的
discriminate辨别,歧视+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.有辨别能力的
encourage鼓励+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.鼓舞人心的
endure持久,持续+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.持久的,不朽的
engross吸引+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.引人入胜的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 非常的,极度的,胜过的,过度的
stems_affixes.word_buile: exceed超出+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.非常的,极度的,胜过的,过度的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 令人兴奋的,使人激动的
stems_affixes.word_buile: excite使兴奋+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.令人兴奋的,使人激动的
exhilarate使高兴+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.使人兴奋的
fascinate使……入迷+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.迷人的,吸引人的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 谄媚的,讨人欢喜的,奉承的
stems_affixes.word_buile: flatter阿谀,奉承+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.谄媚的,讨人欢喜的,奉承的
forego居先+ing……的→adj.在前的,前述的
hard艰难+work工作+ing……的→adj.苦干的,不辞辛劳的
increase增加+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.日益增加的,增大的
inspire鼓舞+ing令人……的→inspiring灌输的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有趣味的,令人好奇[或注意]的
stems_affixes.word_buile: interest使发生兴趣,引起……的注意+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.有趣味的,令人好奇[或注意]的
invite邀请+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.诱人的,引人入胜的
out出+go走+ing正……的或令人……的→走出来→心胸宽→待人友善的
precede先于+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.在前的,前述的
promise允许,答应+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.有希望的,有前途的
refresh使清新+ing令人……的→adj.使心神爽快的
rivet铆钉,固定+ing正……的或令人……的→如铆钉一样把人钉[吸引]住→非常精彩的
threaten恐吓,威胁+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.胁迫的,危险的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 欠缺的,没有的,不够格的
stems_affixes.word_buile: want想+ing……的→想要的→欠缺的
account计算+ing状态物品,行业等→n.会计学
advertise做广告+ing行业→n.广告业;广告活动 adj.广告的;广告业务的
bank银行+ing状态物品,行业等→n.银行业
begin开始,首先+ing状态→n.开始
build建造+ing物→n.建筑[物],房屋,大楼 [同]structure
cloth布+ing物→n.服装,被褥
dance跳舞+ing状态物品,行业等→dancing舞蹈
engineer工程师+ing状态物品,行业等→n.工程[学]
feel感觉+ing状态→n.感情;心情;知觉;同情
fill填充+ing状态物品,行业等→n.充填物,馅
fish鱼+ing状态物品,行业等→n.钓鱼,捕鱼
floor地板+ing物→n.地板材料,铺地板

stems_affixes.value_cn: 立足处;稳固的地位,基础
stems_affixes.word_buile: foot足+ing状态物品,行业等→立足点
gloam变朦胧+ing状态物品,行业等→n.黄昏,薄暮
greet问候+ing状态物品,行业等→n.祝贺,问候
handwrite书法;笔迹+ing状态物品,行业等→n.笔迹,书写体,书法,笔势
happen发生+ing状态→n. 事件,意外发生的事
know知道+ing状态→n.知晓;认知
learn学习+ing状态物品,行业等→n.知识,学问;学习
leg腿+ing状态物品,行业等→legging绑腿
moor停船+ing状态物品,行业等→n.停泊处
open开+ing状态物品,行业等→n.开,开放,开始
shoe鞋+make制造+ing状态物品,行业等→n.制鞋修补皮鞋
change变化+ing正……的或令人……的→正在变化的
proceed进行+ing正……的或令人……的→行动,进行
age年龄+ing状态→n.成熟,变老
consider考虑+ing在……情况下……→v. 考虑,顾及,顾及,考虑到,认为; prep.鉴于,考虑到,顾及
fail错,失败+ing在……情况下……→prep.如果没有……
regard注视+ing在……情况下……→与……相关→关于

stems_affixes.value_cn: 考虑,顾及,顾及,考虑到,认为
stems_affixes.word_buile: consider考虑+ing在……情况下……→v. 考虑,顾及,顾及,考虑到,认为; prep.鉴于,考虑到,顾及

Sentence.sentence: I suspect that whatever Facebook has done so far to invade our privacy, it's only the beginning.
The era of personal technology is in many ways just beginning

The Magician   The revolution that Steve Jobs led is only just beginning When it came to putting on a show, nobody else in the computer industry, or any other industry for that matter, could match Steve Jobs
Though the decline started in the 1970s, it became much steeper beginning in 2000.
The result is a sort of high-quality, unusually rigorous coffee-table book, designed to be dipped into rather than read from beginning to end

These included developing additional domestic sources (such as those on Alaska's North Slope), resuming extraction at sites that had been shut down because of cost inefficiency, capping the price that domestic producers could charge for oil, and beginning to import oil from a greater diversity of nations.

means.word_mean: 开始, 起点; 根源

sentences.en: The discovery of America forms the beginning of a new period.
sentences.cn: 美洲的发现成为一个新时代的开始。

jushi.english: But it was only a small beginning.
jushi.chinese: 但这件事开头规模很小。

jushi.english: Did democracy have its beginnings in Athens?
jushi.chinese: 民主制度是创始于雅典吗?

jushi.english: Many big businesses start from small beginnings.
jushi.chinese: 很多大企业都是从小企业起步的。
